  23. class DashboardView(LoginRequiredMixin, ListView):
  25. """View for dashboard"""
  27. model = Service
  28. queryset = Service.objects.all().select_related().order_by("status", "-log__created").annotate(date=Max('log__created'))
  29. context_object_name = 'services'
  30. template_name = "ftp_deploy/dashboard.html"
  31. paginate_by = 25
  33. def post(self, request, *args, **kwargs):
  34. services = self.get_queryset()
  35. if self.request.POST['services']:
  36. services = services.filter(pk=self.request.POST['services'])
  37. return render_to_response('ftp_deploy/service/list.html', locals(), context_instance=RequestContext(request))
  40. class ServiceManageView(LoginRequiredMixin, DetailView):
  42. """View for manage services"""
  44. model = Service
  45. context_object_name = 'service'
  46. template_name = "ftp_deploy/service/manage.html"
  48. def get_context_data(self, **kwargs):
  50. context = super(ServiceManageView, self).get_context_data(**kwargs)
  51. context['recent_logs'] = self.object.log_set.all()[:15]
  52. context['fail_logs'] = self.object.log_set.filter(status=0).filter(skip=0)
  53. return context

  97. class ServiceStatusView(JSONResponseMixin, LoginRequiredMixin, SingleObjectMixin, View):
  99. """View for update(save) and check service status"""
  101. model = Service
  103. def post(self, request, *args, **kwargs):
  104. service = self.get_object()
  105. service.save()
  106. response = request.POST.get('response', '')
  108. if response == 'list':
  109. services = list()
  110. services.append(service)
  111. return render_to_response('ftp_deploy/service/list.html', locals(), context_instance=RequestContext(request))
  113. if response == 'manage':
  114. recent_logs = service.log_set.all()[:15]
  115. fail_logs = service.log_set.filter(status=0).filter(skip=0)
  116. return render_to_response('ftp_deploy/service/manage.html', locals(), context_instance=RequestContext(request))
  118. if response == 'json':
  119. context = {
  120. 'status': service.status,
  121. 'status_message': service.status_message,
  122. 'updated': service.updated
  123. }
  124. return self.render_json_response(context)
  126. raise Http404
  129. class ServiceRestoreView(LoginRequiredMixin, DetailView):
  131. """"View for build restore path for service"""
  133. model = Service
  134. prefetch_related = ["log_set"]
  135. template_name = "ftp_deploy/service/restore-modal.html"
  137. def get_context_data(self, **kwargs):
  138. context = super(ServiceRestoreView, self).get_context_data(**kwargs)
  140. logs = self.get_logs_tree()
  142. context['payload'] = json.loads(logs[0].payload)
  143. context['payload']['user'] = 'Restore'
  144. context['service'] = self.get_object()
  146. commits = list()
  147. for log in logs:
  148. payload = json.loads(log.payload)
  149. commits += payload['commits']
  151. context['payload']['commits'] = commits
  152. context['payload'] = json.dumps(context['payload'])
  154. context['files_added'], context['files_modified'], context['files_removed'] = commits_parser(commits).file_diff()
  155. context['commits_info'] = commits_parser(commits).commits_info()
  157. return context
  159. def post(self, request, *args, **kwargs):
  161. if request.POST['payload']:
  162. self.get_logs_tree().delete()
  164. return HttpResponse(reverse('ftpdeploy_deploy', args=(self.get_object().secret_key,)))
  166. def get_logs_tree(self):
  167. """get logs tree for restore deploys. Include all logs since first fail apart of skiped."""
  168. first_fail_log = self.get_object().log_set.filter(status=0).filter(skip=0).order_by('pk')[:1]
  169. logs = self.get_object().log_set.filter(skip=0).filter(pk__gte=first_fail_log[0].pk).order_by('pk')
  170. return logs
  173. class ServiceNotificationView(LoginRequiredMixin, UpdateView):
  175. model = Service
  176. form_class = ServiceNotificationForm
  177. template_name = "ftp_deploy/notification/notification-modal.html"
  179. def get_success_url(self):
  180. return reverse('ftpdeploy_service_manage', kwargs={'pk': self.kwargs['pk']})
  182. def form_valid(self, form):
  183. self.object.check = False
  184. messages.add_message(self.request, messages.SUCCESS, 'Service notification has been updated.')
  185. return super(ServiceNotificationView, self).form_valid(form)
  188. class BitbucketAPIView(LoginRequiredMixin, JSONResponseMixin, SingleObjectMixin, View):
  190. """View for managing BitBucket API"""
  192. model = Service
  194. def dispatch(self, *args, **kwargs):
  195. self.bitbucket_username = BITBUCKET_SETTINGS['username']
  196. self.bitbucket_password = BITBUCKET_SETTINGS['password']
  197. return super(BitbucketAPIView, self).dispatch(*args, **kwargs)
  199. def post(self, request, *args, **kwargs):
  200. try:
  201. curl = curl_connection(self.bitbucket_username, self.bitbucket_password)
  202. curl.authenticate()
  203. post = str()
  205. if self.request.POST['data'] == 'respositories':
  206. context = self.repositories(curl)
  207. elif self.request.POST['data'] == 'addhook':
  208. context = self.add_hook(curl, request)
  210. return self.render_json_response(context)
  212. finally:
  213. curl.close()
  215. return HttpResponse()
  217. def repositories(self, curl):
  218. """Load list of repositories from bitbucket account"""
  220. url = 'https://bitbucket.org/api/1.0/user/repositories'
  221. context = curl.perform(url)
  222. return context
  224. def add_hook(self, curl, request):
  225. """Add hook and change repo_hook flag for service"""
  227. service = self.get_object()
  228. url = 'https://api.bitbucket.org/1.0/repositories/%s/%s/services/ ' % (self.bitbucket_username, self.get_object().repo_slug_name)
  229. post = 'type=POST&URL=%s%s' % (absolute_url(request).build(), service.hook_url())
  230. service.repo_hook = True
  231. service.save()
  232. context = curl.perform_post(url, post)
  233. return context
